name: Atrium
short_description: The barren stone room is bathed in moonlight casting long shadows that seem to hide some sort of a secret. A single stone bench offers a brief respite from the outside world.
long_description: The main room of the annex is a barren stone atrium. Moonlight shines through the skylight above as well as through the plethora of openings in the wall that serve as windows. At the center stands a lone stone bench next to a circular pedestal which seems to be completely empty.

annex entryway.description: The way out of the annex is covered in mushrooms, though still passable. There is light coming from outside.

tower entrance.description: The revealed archway leads in the direction of the tower. As it is too dark to see, the only option is to try your luck.

stone wall.description: This wall seems to be adjoining the tower. Now, where is the entrance?

stone bench.description: A simple stone bench located next to the pedestal. The moonlight from the skylight seems to shine directly upon it.

stone pedestal.description: The pedestal is a perfectly circular piece of stone that stands at the center of the room. Usually you would expect something akin to a statue here. Upon closer inspection, there seems to be three circular indentations in its base.

skylight.description: The most prominent feature of the room, the skylight is wide and overlooks a large swathe of the night sky. Looking above, you see nothing but the light of stars falling down upon you. You think this would be a good place for stargazing.
